episodes.title: Jehovah's Witnesses and the 144,000
episodes.description:
*Please read* In this video, I refute the Jehovah's Witness doctrine that states only 144,000 can be born again. JW's believe that there are two classes of believers; the heavenly class (anointed class, little flock) who will be resurrected to heaven and the earthly class (the great multitude of Jesus' other sheep) who will be resurrected to paradise earth.

0:02 - John 3 Reading
1:28 I failed to mention that in 2007, the Watchtower changed the 1935 doctrine. They now teach that an anointed Christian can fall away and another JW can take their spot. (Watchtower 2007 May 1 pp. 30-31) 
2:47 The two classes - the 144,000 vs the Great Crowd
3:43 - Quick WT History Recap 
6:35 - The context of John 3
10:44 - How to approach Jehovah's Witnesses about this topic
11:43 - Revelation 7: 4
20:34 - Revelation 14: -1-3
22:55 - John 10
25:49 - Additional Questions


 Email: allforthekingofglory@gmail.com
Instagram.com/caligirl7525

#JehovahsWitnesses #Caligirl7525 #JWORG

episodes.title: A Conversation with a Kind Jehovah's Witness
episodes.description:
This conversation took place last May. In the beginning of this video my vest moves in front of my camera so it looks like I was hiding it. My camera was totally visible and I told them I was recording (this is a real touristy spot, so it’s not odd to have a camera out). Is Jesus Christ the First and the Last, the Alpha and Omega, the Beginning and the End?
 Disclaimer: I don't believe Jesus is the Father. I know my Jehovah's Witness friends (or those who still think like the JW's) will eventually come on here and accuse me of being pagan and how Jesus can't be God because he prayed to the Father. SO, please do yourself a favor and research the Hypostatic Union and how Jesus had two natures, divine and human. https://carm.org/dictionary-hypostatic-union 

Also, the Watchtower mostly describes the Trinity in Modalism terms. Please look at the difference: https://carm.org/what-is-the-trinity 
https://carm.org/trinity

What does it mean to be the Alpha and Omega? https://www.gotquestions.org/alpha-and-omega.html


P.S. They knew I was recording, I told them and my camera was in plain sight. 
*********
You can contact me here:
allforthekingofglory@gmail.com
instagram.com/caligirl7525
http://religiouschic.blogspot.com/
******************************
""Thus says the LORD, the King of Israel and his Redeemer, the LORD of hosts: 'I am the first and I am the last, And there is no God besides Me." Isaiah 44: 6
"I am the Alpha and the Omega," says the Lord God, "who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty." Rev 1: 8
"When I saw Him, I fell at His feet like a dead man. And He placed His right hand on me, saying, "Do not be afraid; I am the first and the last, and the living One; and I was dead, and behold, I am alive forevermore, and I have the keys of death and of Hades." Rev 1:17-18
"I am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, the beginning and the end." Rev 22:13



What did the early church fathers believe? https://carm.org/intro-ecf
Historical evidence for Jesus: http://www.reasonablefaith.org/rediscovering-the-historical-jesus-the-evidence-for-jesus
